Could you please share the JSON data that needs to be prettified? Currently, I only see `JSON.stringify(data)` but not the actual data content. To prettify JSON, you can use: ```typescript JSON.stringify(data, null, 2) ``` This will add proper indentation and line breaks to make the JSON more readable. If you share the actual JSON data, I can show you how it would look when prettified. ```tsx lokal-link/src/app/debug/page.tsx:10-10 // Excerpt from: const page 
{JSON.stringify(data, null, 2)}
``` does pre tag support text wrapping? By default, the `
` tag does not wrap text - it preserves whitespace and line breaks exactly as they appear in the source, and content will overflow horizontally.

However, you can enable text wrapping on a `
` tag using CSS:

```tsx

  {JSON.stringify(data, null, 2)}


```

This will make the text wrap while still preserving the formatting and indentation of the JSON structure.
